newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine March tax revenue up 8.8 pct from '96.
newsitem.headline: Argentine March tax revenue up 8.8 pct from '96.

text.p: Argentina's government collected $3.548 billion in taxes in March, up 8.8 pct from the same month in 1996, the Economy Ministry said Tuesday.
The figure compared with an average forecast by economists polled by Reuters of $3.55 billion.
Tax revenues were down 2.6 percent from February.
Including money collected for the private pension system, total revenues were $3.80 billion, 9.8 percent more than in March last year but three percent below February.
Revenues from value-added tax were $1.59 billion, the same as in March 1996. Income tax reveues were $527.8 million, up 8.7 percent from March last year.
